meanings.definition: To crawl outwards or away from a central point.
meanings.sent1: The baby was outcrawling from the center of the room towards the toys.
meanings.sent2: The ants were outcrawling in search of food.
meanings.sent3: The snail was outcrawling at a snail's pace, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The vines outcrawling from the tree created a beautiful natural curtain.
meanings.sent5: The spider was outcrawling along the ceiling, looking for a cozy corner to build its web.

meanings.definition: The act of moving or crawling outwards.
meanings.sent1: The outcrawling of the caterpillars from the nest was a fascinating sight.
meanings.sent2: The outcrawling of the crowd from the stadium was slow due to the bottleneck at the gate.
meanings.sent3: The outcrawling of the puppies from their den was met with cheers and applause.
meanings.sent4: The outcrawling of the roots from the soil symbolized growth and expansion.
meanings.sent5: The outcrawling of the waves along the shore created a soothing rhythm.
